problem.title: CheckPoint: Yo-Yo
problem.script:
from __future__ import division from loncapa import *
a=lc_random(1,3,1) b=lc_random(1,3,1) c=lc_random(1,3,1) f=lc_random(1,3,1) m=lc_choose(a,0.12,0.25,0.8) II=lc_choose(b,0.064,0.096,0.12) r=lc_choose(c,0.02,0.03,0.035) dd=lc_choose(f,0.8,1.1,1.4)
v= r* math.sqrt(2* m* dd*9.8/( II+ m* r* r))
problem.p: A yo-yo has mass $m kg and rotational inertia $II \(kg m^2\). A light thin string is wrapped around the central part of the yo-yo that has radius $r m. The string is attached to the ceiling as shown. The yo-yo is released from rest and begins to descend as the string unwraps.
problem.part:
Part 1. Describe the major energy transformation that takes place .
kinetic rotational into kinetic translational<
kinetic translational into kinetic rotational
gravitational potential into kinetic rotational
gravitational potential into kinetic translational
kinetic translational into kinetic rotational and gravitational potential
kinetic rotational into kinetic translational and gravitational potential
gravitational potential into kinetic translational and kinetic rotational

Part 2. what is the relationship between the linear speed \(v\) of the center of mass of the yo-yo and its angular speed \(\omega\)?
\( v = \omega r\)
\( v = \omega / r \)
\( v = 2 \omega r \)
\( v = 2 \omega / r \)
\( v = \omega r/2 \)
\( v = \omega / (2 r) \)

part.p: Use conservation of energy to find the linear speed of the yo-yo by the time it descended a distance $dd m. Use g = 9.8 m/s2.
